results.title: HMG CoA reductase inhibitors (statins) to treat Epstein-Barr virus-driven lymphoma
results.text_hl: Statins may have a role in the treatment of @DISEASE_Epstein_Barr_Virus_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D020031 @@@EBV@@@-driven @<m>DISEASE_Lymphoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008223 @@@lymphomas@@@, most likely as part of combination therapy for these @<m>DISEASE_Lymphoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008223 @@@lymphomas@@@.

results.title: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors induce apoptosis of lymphoma cells by promoting ROS generation and regulating Akt, Erk and p38 signals via suppression of mevalonate pathway
results.text_hl: However, @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@fluvastatin@@@ showed higher @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@cytotoxicity@@@ towards @<m>DISEASE_Lymphoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008223 @@@lymphoma@@@ cells than @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.
